description.value:
Picking out a spell or a creature affected by magic you wish to dispel, you make a sudden cutting motion with your hand and speak a single word of disruptive power. The chosen spell rapidly reverses itself if you chose a single spell. If you chose a creature, any magic clinging to them fades away.


Utility Spell


When you cast this spell, you attempt to end one or more magical effects, as described below.

  • You instantly dispel spells of 2nd level or lower.*

  • If the target spell is 3rd level or higher, roll a spellcasting ability check (1d20 + your spellcasting ability modifier). The DC for this check is 10 + the spell's level. Rolling a 20 always succeeds.

  • When attempting to dispel a magical effect created by a creature that is not a spell, the DC is 10 + twice the creature's proficiency bonus. If the effect was not created by a creature, the DC is usually 15. The GM can decide in unusual cases whether the DC should be higher or lower than 15.

  • Targeting One Spell, Summoned Creature, or Effect: If successful, you end the spell or magical effect for all affected creatures. If a creature used the same spell or magical effect more than once, you only end one instance of the effect.

  • Targeting One Creature or Object: You attempt to dispel every spell or magical effect on the target. Roll once for all spells or magical effects. You do not dispel area of effect spells, like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.x76d4kCFyMIc6wQZ]{Entangle} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.DR28lbu7yQr8myGX]{Reverse Gravity} .

  • You cannot dispel permanent magical effects or permanent spells (like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.fsKqUGAIN0YXi4Dm]{Arcane Lock} or the effects of an instantaneous spell like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.cUNPAfIYP7tiEHo9]{Druidcraft} ). You also cannot dispel &reference[cursed]{curses}.


*Upcasting: This spell can automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is at least one level lower than the Dispel Magic spell. For example, a 5th level Dispel Magic automatically ends all spells of 4th level or lower.
